Title: Differentiation therapy for glioblastoma–too many obstacles?
Abstract: © 2016, © 2016 The Author(s). Published with license by Taylor & Francis Group, LLC. © 2016, © Helena Carén, Stephan Beck, and Steven M. Pollard.The therapeutic potential of differentiation therapy for glioblastoma will depend on the robustness and stability of the differentiated state. We recently reported several obstacles to bone morphogenetic protein (BMP)-induced differentiation therapy. Improved understanding of the mechanisms that tumor cells use to escape differentiation commitment is urgently needed.
